intro: Fumana viscida var. papillosa, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, silky leaves that give it a soft, velvety appearance. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring. This species thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
